definition: to learn sth through hearsay/to get wind of sth

sentences.english: What was your reaction when you first got wind of it?
sentences.chinese: 當你第一次風聞這事的時候你是什麼反應？

sentences.english: Sally got wind of the rumours about her.
sentences.chinese: 薩利風聞關於她的謠言。

sentences.english: But Father got wind of it, though not quite in time, and was after him as quickly as he could.
sentences.chinese: 但我父親風聞其事，雖然不太及時，還是盡力地追趕。

sentences.english: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
sentences.chinese: 滅沒和死亡說，我們風聞其名。

sentences.english: Sally got wind of the rumors about her.
sentences.chinese: 薩麗風聞關於她的謠言。

sentences.english: I've heard that he is as well-known as Johnson herself.
sentences.chinese: 我風聞他跟約翰生本人自己一樣聞名。

sentences.english: I heard that he is a worker.
sentences.chinese: 我傳講風聞他是一個工人。

sentences.english: But now at last their turn has come. Before, they had only heard of the mystery, but now they feel it.
sentences.chinese: 以前他們只風聞這個奧祕，如今他們親身嚐到了。
